author: Akane Otani
title: U.S. Government Bond Prices Retreat as Investorsâ€™ Trade Fears Wane
text:
Investors sold U.S. government bonds as global stocks rallied, lifted by bets that the U.S. and China would be able to negotiate to soften the blow of announced trade tariffs.
Bond yields rose overnight, then pared advances heading into the opening of the U.S. stock market, with the yield on the 10-year note recently at 2.815%, according to Tradeweb, compared with 2.788% Wednesday.
